message:
For PHP Developers who compare between "Netbeans", "PHPStorm", and "SubLime" as a code editor ... My opinion is:
Netbeans sucks...
PHPStorm is professional but heavyweight...
Sublime wins the battle among all....
What do you think?

data.message: I will put it like this: "PHPStorm changed my life"
I didn't try phpstorm nor netbeans but i did try sublime and it's awesome :'D
Does Brackets get in the list?
I exclusively use Komodo Edit now. I have no idea why people use NetBeans and I used to love Sublime but sadly had to give it up for its lack of RTL languages support which I need.
Aha i searshed for that problem with rtl lang and i didn't find a solution :/
Never compare a text Editor with an IDE becuse no matter how mush this text editor is good he can't compete any IDE.

For PHP IDE .. PhpStorm wins, For a text Editor Sublime is the best out there but i guess for not so long as atom is growing really fast and github is supporting it and its Open source.
Simply as a web developer i need both daily .. for heavy work in adding a new big feature and need some IDE features to inject in my whole project directory PHPStorm is unbeatable at this point, in the other hand if i wanted to edit a PHP file on the fly under a hotfix or something sublime is really fast and can be more than enough for this cases.
My Current machine as u can see both are always together ;) good luck.
PhpStorm 9 EAP (Early Access Program) is incredible. Full release is soon
netbeans is not only an enhanced editor i use it instead of fileZila and git  and some times i use it instead of phpmyadmin

PHP Storm = Excellent Auto-completion and Code refactoring (my fav feature) and formatting, Vagrant Support, GIT, SASS, Live Templates, Database Manager, Remote Access/Sync, and much much more ... nothing compares to it.
I hope someone ports over Predawn as a PHPStorm theme! I love ST3 mainly because of it

Islam Gad
sorry for this question 
what is your machine OS , it looks pretty good msa and l don't know what is it :D :D
it is curiosity not any more
